column4: hello, does anyone know how to tell wine to run in 32-bit color by default?
wine cannot change the bit depth.
oh.. how do people get games to work if you can't get 32 bit color?
you will have to set X11 to the right bit depth before you start wine
my desktop is running in 32 bit
if you don't, wine will convert the colors for you - but it will be dread slow. you might have some luck with the "emulate virtual desktop" option in winecfg
wait are you trying to run bf2?
no.. trying to run fate, old game
is it in the AppDB (the winehq page)
i wasn't aware of an appdb, i'm new to it :)
doesn't show up in a search :(
magnetron,: no, it's a windows game. when i run it, it says "this game must be run in 16 or 32 bit color mode"
try to enable "emulate virtual desktop" in winecfg
it looks really ugly, like it's in 256 color mode :(
try to post the results in the appdb, and file a bug. that will speed up the process of making the game supported by wine
